PREDICTION: Prediction of fungicidal pests in crops through Artificial Intelligence
GLOSSARY_DESCRIPTION: Glossary of pests available to be predicted
UPLOAD_IMAGE: Upload an image of the crop leaves to determine if they have any diseases
EXPLICABILIDAD_GRAD_CAM: Explainability of the model with Grad-CAM
GRAD_CAM_DESCRIPTION: Grad-CAM (Gradient-weighted Class Activation Mapping) is a technique that helps understand the decisions of deep learning models by analyzing images. It shows which parts of an image are most important for the model's prediction:
GRAD_CAM_STEP1: Calculates the gradients of the class of interest with respect to the internal layers of the model.
GRAD_CAM_STEP2: Averages these gradients to obtain weights for each filter.
GRAD_CAM_STEP3: Uses these weights to highlight the parts of the image that influence the prediction.
GRAD_CAM_STEP4: Generates a map that shows the most important areas of the image.
UNDERSTAND_PREDICTIONS_DESC: Shows which parts of the leaf are important for the prediction, increasing confidence in the model.
MODEL_VALIDATION_DESC: Ensures that the model uses relevant information.
MODEL_IMPROVEMENT_DESC: Identifies errors and allows adjustments to improve accuracy.
CLEAR_COMMUNICATION_DESC: Facilitates explaining predictions to partners and stakeholders.
RESEARCH_DEVELOPMENT_DESC: Helps experiment and optimize models and data.

APPLE_SCAB_DESCRIPTION: Apple Scab is a fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis that primarily affects apple trees. It causes dark spots on leaves and fruits, reducing the quality of the harvest. The spores of the fungus spread in cool, moist conditions. For control, proper pruning, removal of infected debris, and application of specific fungicides are recommended.
APPLE_BLACK_ROT_DESCRIPTION: Apple Black Rot is a fungal disease caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa, affecting apple trees. It causes black spots on leaves, branches, and fruits, reducing the quality of the harvest. To control it, proper pruning, removal of infected debris, and use of specific fungicides are recommended.
APPLE_CEDAR_RUST_DESCRIPTION: Apple Cedar and Apple Rust is a fungal disease caused by Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae, affecting apple trees and cedars. It causes orange spots on leaves and deformations in fruits, reducing the quality of the harvest. To control it, infected debris should be removed, apple trees and cedars should be separated, and specific fungicides should be applied.
HEALTHY_APPLE_TREE_DESCRIPTION: Apple leaves are essential for photosynthesis and the growth of the tree. They are oval-shaped with serrated edges, have a smooth texture, and are bright green in color. The health of the leaves is crucial as it reflects the overall well-being of the apple tree and its ability to produce quality fruits.
BLUEBERRY_DESCRIPTION: Blueberry leaves are fundamental for photosynthesis and the growth of the plant. They are small, oval-shaped, and have smooth edges, with a bright green color that turns reddish in the fall. The health of the leaves is vital, indicating the overall condition of the plant and its ability to produce high-quality fruits.
CHERRY_DESCRIPTION: Cherry leaves are crucial for photosynthesis and the growth of the tree. They are oval-shaped with serrated edges, bright green in color, which can change to yellow and red tones in autumn. The health of the leaves is essential as it reflects the overall well-being of the cherry tree and its ability to produce quality cherries.
CHERRY_POWDERY_MILDEW_DESCRIPTION: Cherry Powdery Mildew is a fungal disease caused by Podosphaera clandestina, affecting the leaves, flowers, and fruits of cherry trees. It appears as a white powder on the surface of the leaves, causing deformities and weakening of the tree. To control this disease, proper pruning, removal of infected debris, and application of specific fungicides are recommended.
GRAPE_BLACK_ROT_DESCRIPTION: Grape Black Rot is a disease caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii. It affects vines in warm and humid climates, manifesting as black spots on leaves, stems, and fruits. This can reduce both the quality and quantity of the harvest. Symptoms include dark lesions on leaves and fruits, and cankers on canes. Control is based on proper pruning, the use of specific fungicides, and the removal of infected plant material.
GRAPE_ESCA_DESCRIPTION: Grape Esca Black Measles is crucial for the support and transport of nutrients in the plant. Its health is critical, as diseases like esca and eutypa dieback can reduce productivity. Proper management includes pruning, wound treatment, and monitoring to prevent infections and ensure optimal grape production.
GRAPE_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: Grape leaves are vital for photosynthesis and plant growth. Their health directly affects grape production. Diseases like downy mildew and powdery mildew can damage the leaves, reducing photosynthetic efficiency. Proper management includes constant monitoring, preventive treatments, and removal of affected leaves to keep the plant healthy and productive.
PEPPER_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: The pepper leaf (Pepper bell) is essential for photosynthesis and plant growth. Oval-shaped and bright green, these leaves are susceptible to diseases such as bacterial spot and downy mildew. Maintaining leaf health involves regular monitoring, preventive treatments, and pest control. Healthy leaves ensure better quality and productivity in pepper harvests.
POTATO_EARLY_BLIGHT_DESCRIPTION: Potato early blight, caused by the fungus Alternaria solani, primarily affects the leaves, causing dark spots with concentric rings that can lead to premature defoliation. This disease reduces the quality and quantity of the harvest. Management includes the use of specific fungicides, crop rotation, and removal of infected plant debris to control the spread of the fungus.
POTATO_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: The potato leaf is essential for photosynthesis and plant growth. Compound and dark green, these leaves are vulnerable to diseases such as early and late blight. Maintaining leaf health involves regular monitoring, preventive treatments, and pest control. Healthy leaves are crucial for ensuring a bountiful and high-quality potato harvest.
POTATO_LATE_BLIGHT_DESCRIPTION: Potato late blight, caused by Phytophthora infestans, causes brown spots and watery lesions on leaves, stems, and tubers, potentially destroying crops rapidly. Management includes resistant varieties, specific fungicides, and cultural practices such as crop rotation and removal of infected residues.
RASPBERRY_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: The raspberry leaf (Raspberry) is vital for photosynthesis and plant development. Oval and serrated, with a bright green color, it is susceptible to diseases such as powdery mildew and rust. Maintaining leaf health involves regular monitoring, preventive treatments, and pest control. Healthy leaves ensure an abundant and high-quality raspberry production.
SOYBEAN_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: The soybean leaf is essential for photosynthesis and plant growth. Trifoliate and green, it is vulnerable to diseases such as anthracnose and downy mildew. Maintaining leaf health requires regular monitoring, preventive treatments, and pest control. Healthy leaves are crucial for ensuring an abundant and high-quality bean harvest.
SQUASH_POWDERY_MILDEW_DESCRIPTION: Squash powdery mildew is a disease caused by fungi such as Podosphaera xanthii and Erysiphe cichoracearum. It appears as white powder on the leaf surface, affecting photosynthesis and weakening the plant. Management includes the application of fungicides, selection of resistant varieties, and cultural practices such as removing infected leaves and improving air circulation around plants.
STRAWBERRY_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: The strawberry leaf (Strawberry) is crucial for photosynthesis and plant growth. Trifoliate and bright green, these leaves are susceptible to diseases such as powdery mildew and leaf spot. Maintaining leaf health involves regular monitoring, preventive treatments, and pest control. Healthy leaves ensure an abundant and high-quality strawberry production.
STRAWBERRY_SUNSCALD_DESCRIPTION: Strawberry sunscald, caused by sun exposure and high temperatures, results in leaves with brown and dry edges. Managing it requires providing shade, regular watering, and maintaining good soil conditions, thereby ensuring optimal strawberry production.
TOMATO_BACTERIAL_SPOT_DESCRIPTION: Tomato bacterial spot, caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria, causes dark spots on leaves, stems, and fruits. Management includes bactericides, resistant varieties, and cultural practices such as crop rotation and removal of infected plants. This ensures healthy tomato production.
TOMATO_EARLY_BLIGHT_DESCRIPTION: Tomato early blight, caused by Alternaria solani, appears as brown spots with concentric rings on leaves and stems. Management includes fungicides, crop rotation, and removal of infected plant debris to maintain healthy tomato production.
TOMATO_HEALTHY_LEAF_DESCRIPTION: Tomato leaves are compound and essential for photosynthesis, transpiration, and respiration. These functions allow the conversion of sunlight into energy, temperature regulation, and nutrient absorption, being crucial for plant health and productivity.
TOMATO_LATE_BLIGHT_DESCRIPTION: Tomato late blight, caused by Phytophthora infestans, causes brown spots and watery lesions on leaves, stems, and tubers, potentially destroying crops rapidly. Management includes resistant varieties, specific fungicides, and cultural practices such as crop rotation and removal of infected residues.
TOMATO_DOWNY_MILDEW_DESCRIPTION: Tomato downy mildew, caused by the fungus Pseudoperonospora cubensis, primarily affects leaves, creating yellow spots that turn brown and necrotic. The disease thrives in cool, humid conditions, significantly reducing productivity. Control includes fungicides, resistant varieties, and good agricultural practices to minimize foliage moisture.
TOMATO_SEPTORIA_SPOT_DESCRIPTION: Tomato septoria leaf spot, caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici, causes small black spots on leaves, which turn yellow and fall prematurely. This disease thrives in warm, humid conditions, reducing photosynthesis and affecting production. Management includes fungicides, crop rotation, and removal of infected plant debris.
TOMATO_SPIDER_MITE_DESCRIPTION: Tomato spider mites (Two spotted spider mite) are pests that suck the sap from leaves, causing yellow spots, desiccation, and defoliation. They thrive in warm, dry conditions, reducing photosynthesis and productivity. Control includes acaricides, biological control, and maintaining adequate humidity in the crop.
TOMATO_TARGET_SPOT_DESCRIPTION: Tomato target spot, caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola, produces circular lesions with a dark center on leaves, stems, and fruits. This disease develops in warm, humid conditions, reducing the quality and quantity of the harvest. Control includes fungicides, crop rotation, and removal of infected plant debris.
TOMATO_MOSAIC_VIRUS_DESCRIPTION: Tomato mosaic virus causes mottling and yellowing on leaves, deformations, and reduced growth. It is transmitted by contact and contaminated tools, affecting production quality and quantity. Management includes resistant varieties, tool disinfection, and hygiene practices in the crop.
TOMATO_YELLOW_LEAF_CURL_VIRUS_DESCRIPTIO: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus causes leaf curling and yellowing, as well as stunted growth and reduced yield. It is primarily transmitted by the whitefly. Control includes resistant varieties, whitefly management, and hygiene practices in the crop.
GRAD_CAM_CONCLUSION: Grad-CAM provides us with a visual way to understand and improve our model for predicting pests in plant leaves, making decisions more transparent and reliable.
